entry.title: a photograph (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that six-tenths of a second is one reason that a photograph (pictured) won a Pulitzer Prize?

entry.title: Keshawn Banks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Keshawn Banks's only NFL appearance came in the playoffs?

entry.title: Pamatan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Pamatan is an undiscovered city on Lombok that was destroyed by the 1257 Samalas eruption?

entry.title: Ian Begg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ian Begg, known for his work on restoration of castles in Scotland, designed and built his own 20th-century tower house to live in?

entry.title: Civ-Alert (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an editorial cartoon in The Honolulu Advertiser called Civ-Alert "Hawaii's Paul Revere"?

entry.title: Peter d'Hamecourt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Peter d'Hamecourt was asked to pay for taxi fares with 24 cans of Heineken?

entry.title: Training Season (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dua Lipa premiered "Training Season" at the 66th Annual Grammy Awards, 11 days before its official release?

entry.title: Eenoolooapik (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Eenoolooapik fell ill while kayaking through Aberdeen in traditional Inuit clothing?
